message.content:
cs.IT, cs.NI, cs.CR, cs.DS, cs.SY. 

The paper deals with network coding and its vulnerability to Byzantine attacks, which are common in the field of information theory (cs.IT). The paper also discusses the transmission overhead associated with detecting Byzantine adversaries, which falls under the category of network protocols and algorithms (cs.NI). Additionally, the paper discusses the robustness of network coding against failures and erasures, which is a topic in computer security (cs.CR). The paper also involves analyzing the tradeoff between generation size and overhead of detection, which is a topic in distributed systems (cs.DS) and control systems (cs.SY).
